error.signature: Could not connect to Redis/Memcached endpoint: Connection timed out
error.regex: (Could not connect to .+ endpoint|ElastiCache .+ connection (refused|timed out)|ECONNREFUSED.*6379)

verdict.summary: Application cannot connect to ElastiCache cluster, usually due to VPC, security group, or subnet configuration.

dead_ends.action: Try to connect to ElastiCache from outside the VPC
dead_ends.why_fails: ElastiCache is VPC-only by default and not accessible from the public internet

dead_ends.action: Reboot the ElastiCache cluster to fix connection issues
dead_ends.why_fails: If the issue is network configuration, rebooting doesn't change security groups or subnet routing

workarounds.action: Ensure the client is in the same VPC and security group allows inbound on the cache port
workarounds.how: Check security group allows inbound TCP on port 6379 (Redis) or 11211 (Memcached) from the client's security group

workarounds.action: Verify subnet route tables allow traffic between the client and ElastiCache subnets
workarounds.how: Check that both the client and ElastiCache are in subnets with proper route table entries for the VPC CIDR
